Situated on 6 wooded acres between the towns of Bridgehampton, East Hampton and Sag Harbor, in Wainscott, our cottages are the ideal place in a prime location to enjoy all that the Hamptons offers. The ocean beach, Wolffer vineyard, Poxabogue golf driving range, farmstand, horseback riding, restaurants, shopping and galleries are literally minutes away (1-5 miles). Recently renovated, each cottage is appointed with air-conditioning/heating, full bath, kitchenette (gas range, microwave, coffee maker, sink, refrigerator), wood floors, ceiling fan, flat screen cable tv and lighted screened patio with awning and wicker furniture, bringing nature into each cottage. Dog must be leashed at all times, vaccination and flea and tick treatment must be current. Poop bags provided to clean up behind dog while walking property. Dog may be unattended in cottage, provided owner acknowledges dog is well behaved, has no history of disobedience and will not disturb others. Nightly fee $40 (designated cottages). Open year round.

ADDRESS: 401 South New York Road
CITY: Galloway
MAJOR: Atlantic City
STATE: NJ
ZIP: 08205
PHONE: 855-894-8698
TOLLFREE: 
HIGHWAY: None
HIGHWAY1: None
BOOKCOMMENTS: Dogs up to 50 pounds are allowed. There is a $50 one time pet fee.
COMMENTS: Awake relaxed and rejuvenated each morning at our Galloway, NJ resort. Set on lush grounds on the southern New Jersey shore, all of the guest rooms and suites at Seaview offer breathtaking views of the manicured grounds or the Atlantic City skyline. Historic Seaview has served as a retreat for presidents, celebrities and even Princess Grace Kelly. And today, at this New Jersey shore resort, we continue the tradition of excellence. We invite you to experience this award-winning Galloway hotel for yourself.<br><br>27" Flat Screen Televisions<br>Iron / Ironing Board<br>In-room Lavazza Coffee<br>Complimentary Wireless Internet<br>Complimentary High Speed Internet<br>Hairdryer<br>Individual Climate Control<br>Multiple Phone Lines with Speaker and Voicemail<br>In-room Movies<br>Desk<br><br>We welcome small and medium pets at the Stockton Seaview Hotel & Golf Club, A DolceResort, but all guests are subject to the following guidelines:<br>- A non-refundable pet fee of $50 per pet maximum of 2 pets, will be added to theguest room account.<br>- We limit the acceptable cat or dog size to 50 pounds or less.<br>- Pets must be attended to at all times when in the guest room.Before departing the room, the pet must be placed in a carrier or crate.<br>- Pets must be kept on a leash at all times if walking through common hallway areas.<br>- All pet messes (including outdoor messes) must be promptly cleaned andproperly disposed of by the pet owner.Please ask the Front Desk Staff where these should be discarded.Mess Bags will be provided if needed at check-in.<br>- Mess bags are also located on the walking trail on the Pines Golf Course<br>- Pets are not permitted in any indoor Food & Beverage area.<br>- Housekeeping will not enter the room to clean unless the pet is out of the room or in a pet carrier.Please advise Housekeeping when you would like your roomcleaned<br>- If a pet is left unsecured in a guest room and attacks, bites or scratches anemployee, a formal incident report will be completed and forwarded to local authorities.<br>- Guests are responsible for all damages caused by their pet.After departure, the room will be thoroughly inspected and any damages will be placed on the guests account.<br>- Barking or other pet behavior that disturbs or interferes with other guests enjoyable stay will result in a call from management to the pet owner.<br>- We have developed a location were pets are welcome close to our walking paths under beautiful pine trees. Please ask at front desk for location.<br>- Please note: not all rooms or room types allow pets.Please check with the hotel if you have any questions.

OLDCOMMENTS: You are centrally located to all of the wonderful sights of the mountains. The gateway to the  Pisgah National Forest with its 157,000 acres of forest and its hundreds of miles of hiking trails lies just below. At the top of the Forest road lies the Blue Ridge Parkway with high altitudes of over 6400 feet and some of the most beautiful sights on the entire Blue Ridge Parkway. On the other side of you is the DuPont State Forest with 10,000 acres of trails and stunning waterfalls.<br><br>Within minutes lies the city of Asheville with its historic downtown and the Biltmore Estate in the opposite direction are the quaint towns of Hendersonville and Lake Lure. Head south and the road takes you over to Caesar's Head State Park in South Carolina. Yet another way will lead you to Lake Toxaway and further on to the towns of Highlands and Cashiers.<br><br>There are many great activities in the Brevard area such as world-class trout fishing, hiking, rock climbing, rafting, river tubing, horseback riding, zip-lining and mountain biking. The Western Mountains of North Carolina are known for their hospitality so come and join us in the mountains for the ultimate vacation experience with your best friend! Nestled in the mountains just outside of charming Brevard North Carolina, the land of Waterfalls, lies the ultimate dog lover vacation. Stay in our luxurious cabins at Cantrell Mountain, at altitudes of 3000 feet, with thousands of acres of forest surrounding you. Relax in the privacy of the woods and enjoy the slow pace of the Western North Carolina mountains. Taking dog-friendly to a whole new level with our spacious fenced yards and privately placed luxury cabins on one-acre lots. You and your best friend can gain a whole new "leash on life" with optional private training sessions during your stay and we also offer day care plans during your stay with us.<br><br>Spend your time sunning on the porch, or maybe a relaxing hot tub under the evening stars. Enjoy a cozy fire with a book in hand and a nice glass of wine to finish off that pawsitively perfect day!

TITLE: Camp Ribbonwood Wilderness Vacation Retreat
ADDRESS: Call to Arrange
CITY: Warner Springs
MAJOR: San Diego County North
STATE: CA
ZIP: 92086
PHONE: 619 818-9343
TOLLFREE: 
HIGHWAY: None
HIGHWAY1: None
BOOKCOMMENTS: This vacation rental 6 miles from the nearest store is a private cabin for you and your pet. Hike the Pacific Trail and do other outdoor activities.
COMMENTS: Camp Ribbonwood is a single rustic retreat which offers tranquility, privacy and a close to nature experience. Our motto is "you won't see us unless you need us" and we take our guest's privacy very seriously. We want it to be a place for people to unwind,unplug and relax .<br><br>This unique cabin is located on a private ranch near Warner Springs, California which is a beautiful, remote rural area midway between San Diego and Los Angeles. The 16x20 heavy canvas timberframe cabin was made by Colorado Yurt Co.  There is a hot tub and charcoal kettle BBQ with Pizza oven attachment so bring your favorite ingredients for Pizzas. We are pet friendly......we love dogs and provide a fenced yard for them to run free, be dogs and enjoy the beauty of the place. The deck is fenced so you can control their wanderings or you can let them access the large fenced yard and everything is fairly pooch proof .<br><br>Camp Ribbonwood is most suitable for two people and offers one queen bed.  Insects are negligible but the area is frequented by deer, turkey, quail, bobcat and fox. There is no town or store within 6 miles and the main activities in the area are hiking, mountain biking, horseback riding, stargazing (amazing out here !), birdwatching,wine tasting at one of the 3 fantastic family run vineyards, sky sailing in a glider, visiting nearby Old Town Temecula, eating pies in Julian, taking a tram ride in Palm Springs , hiking a section of the Pacific crest trail and then of course there are the old standbys to pass the time........napping, reading, playing fetch with the dog and gazing out at the view are always worthwhile !

Our favorite sail: Dog Gone Sailing Charters (508.566.0410) with Captain Rosemary, which offers private sailing excursions for 4-6 folks and your animal companion is invited too (though we are not sure they would let your canine play captain in a tri-corner hat and buckle-shoes).<br><br>At Gabriels we also have bowls, pick-up bags, and leashes available if you forget yours. Just stop by the office and also find organic dog treats here! Gabriels complex is located next to the Bas Relief Park where you can take your pet for daily romps in the grass and walkways.<br><br>A comment from our guests, Elaine Craghead and Emily Goldman:<br>"Some places call themselves 'pet friendly' but they really aren't. They hassle guests who bring pets and make staying difficult with extra rules. Gabriel's is a breath of fresh air for dog owners - they are pet embracing. Our dog had a great time and so did we. The dog bed, bowls, and biscuits were a real treat for all of us. Thank-you so much for helping us to have a relaxing and memorable vacation."<br><br>"Until one has loved an animal, part of their soul remains unawakened."

COMMENTS: 60-acre Private Paradise & Pond for People & Pets.<br><br>Escape to the beautiful Sierra foothills to enjoy nature from the comforts of a luxurious hilltop home with spectacular sunset views. OLDCOMMENTS: 60-acre Private Paradise for People & Pets - with Pond & Hot Tub <br><br>HOME: <br>2.5 bedroom, 2 bath (sleeps 7) fully furnished vacation rental by owner<br><br>Escape to the beautiful Sierra foothills to enjoy nature from the comforts of a luxurious hilltop hideaway home with spectacular sunset views. Plenty of entertainment options are available including a big screen TV with Direct TV and Netflix, WiFi, a large game room with foosball, ping pong, and darts.  The outdoor features are just as amazing starting with a beautiful swimming pond, basketball court and miles of hiking trails.  A covered patio with seating and hot tub provides a perfect place to watch the sun set over the neighboring vineyards, and then light up the fire pit and gaze at the stars while listening to the crickets chirp<br><br>PETS: <br>What makes our Dog & Pony Ranch so special are the features that have been designed for 4-footed family members who are not only "pets considered" but PETS WELCOME!   No extra charges for well-behaved pets (unless damages).  We chose stained concrete throughout most of the house which is not only beautiful but also easily cleaned. New leather sofas and chairs repel dog hair and no delicate decor is below tail level. An artificial grass front lawn is perfect for fetch sessions or agility training. There is a dog-door to our wrought iron fenced 'back yard'. We've also field-fenced the perimeter of our 60-acre property so dogs can roam off-leash. Miles of well-marked private hiking trails through the rolling hills (2200 foot elevation) provide exciting deer, rabbit, turkey and other wildlife smells for your canines to explore with you. We also have a barn, pasture and arena for those interested in bringing their horses. Our dogs' favorite feature is the large swimming pond complete with a dock where our dogs practice their dock diving. Yes, people can enjoy the hiking and swimming too, but we think it's so much better with man's best friend by your side!<br><br>NEARBY:<br>Dog & Pony Ranch is the best of both worlds with the privacy of 60 fenced rural acres plus the conveniences of being only a few miles from town (Pine Grove, Jackson and Sutter Creek).  When you're ready to venture off the property, there is even more to do within a 15-60 minute drive including 37 Amador County wineries, winter skiing at Kirkwood, casino and shows at Jackson Rancheria, cave exploration, golf courses, many nearby lakes and rivers, antique shopping, gold country historical sites, and much more.  See our website for suggestions and links to local activities.

COMMENTS: Our Northern Virginia dog friendly resort does allow guests to bring their canine cohorts with them to enjoy during their visit. At Lansdowne Resort, we understand how important your four-legged friend is to you. Our lush grounds around the resort are perfect for exploring, but we ask you do not walk your dog on any of the golf courses for your own safety. <br><br>The Potomac Heritage Trail is a short walk away and is located along the historic Potomac River. Our front desk or concierge will be happy to tell you how to access this serene and peaceful trail for you and your furry friend to explore.<br><br>Our goal is to provide you and your dog a pleasant and fun-filled stay, but also a safe one. For the comfort and safety of all guests and their dogs, we kindly request that all dog owners act responsibly and respect other guests. <br><br> For a list of area pet boarding, walking services, veterinarians, animal hospitals, grooming and area parks near our dog friendly resort in Virginia, <a href="http://www.dogfriendly.com/servlet/refer?from=pageLeesburgVA&dest=http://www.lansdowneresort.com/assets/pdfs/Lansdowne-Dog_Area-Services.pdf?utm_source=dogfriendly.com&utm_medium=media&utm_content=directory_listing&utm_campaign=dogfriendly.com_directory_listing" target="_blank">click here.</a><br><br>Please note the following dog-friendly policies. Prior to checking in, you will be asked to fill out and sign our dog policy agreement.<br><br>Upon booking your reservation, we request you reveal your plans to arrive at our dog friendly hotel in Virginia with your friend.The dog size weight restriction is 75 pounds for a single dog. If two dogs occupy one room with the guest, the weight limit is 50 pounds per dog. Maximum two dogs per room, per visit. A dog policy letter will be presented at the time of check-in, and a non-refundable one-time fee of $100 will be imposed. Your pet should have all recommended vaccinations currently up-to-date, and you agree to obtain and provide current records from a licensed veterinary regarding your pet should Lansdowne Resort request this information from you at any time.<br><br>Pets should be leashed or restrained at all times in public spaces in the hotel or on the property.<br><br>Pets should be supervised at all times while in the hotel or on the property. You have been provided with a list of local pet sitting services which can be arranged for you through the hotel's concierge. Since these services are not provided by Lansdowne Resort we cannot be held responsible for any pet service engaged by you.<br><br>A $20 per hour "time out" fee is assessed by Lansdowne Resort if a pet is left unattended and needs to be removed from a guestroom.<br><br>Guests should display the special Lansdowne Resort Pet "Do Not Disturb" sign to alert housekeeping that a pet is in residence.<br><br>Pets are not allowed in food & beverage areas, the Health & Fitness Center, near any of the pools, indoor meeting and function spaces or on any of the golf courses.<br><br>Guests are responsible for pet waste clean-up inside the resort and throughout the property grounds.<br><br>Guests are responsible for all personal injuries and/or property damage related to their pet(s).<br><br>Guest agrees to indemnify and hold harmless Lansdowne Resort, the hotel, its operators and owners and their respective affiliates from all liability and/or damage suffered as a result of their pet.<br><br>Lansdowne Resort reserves the right to remove guests whose pets are deemed noisy or disruptive.

We have created a standard of excellence for lodging in Charles Town, West Virginia with our warm hospitality to both our guests and their furry friends.Our Harpers Ferry Bed and Breakfast is located on George Washington's first land purchase and we pride ourselves on having created a warm and inviting atmosphere for our guests. Our Cottage Rooms are all dog friendly and our pet friendly lodging in West Virginia policies are: <br><br>    Very well-behaved dogs are welcome with responsible parents/owners.  We accept a maximum of two dogs per suite, and there is a $35 charge per pet, per night.<br><br>    Included in your rate is our "Doggy Bag", which includes plastic bags for poop scooping, a puppy paws towel, and a special treat! We will also supply bowls for food and water.<br><br>    Dogs must be on leashes at all times at Hillbrook Inn.<br><br>    We ask that you do not leave your dog loose in the suite while you are out for the day.  Pets may be left unattended only if crated. (Hillbrook has one pet crate available if needed. Please inquire when making your reservation. Crate rental fee is $35 per night in addition to the $35 pet fee.)<br><br>    We expect that dogs will not disturb other guests by barking or whining. s the premises<br><br>   Poop scooping is required.<br><br>   Owners are responsible in FULL for any damages, as assessed by the innkeepers. (Examples: Chewing of furniture/architectural structures, ruining of carpets by mud/soiling/chewing, destroying of linens or towels)<br><br>    Hillbrook will supply special towels for our furry friend's paws. If our bathroom towels are used, there will be an additional charge incurred of $15 per towel. To avoid charges, please notify a staff member that more towels are needed, and we will be happy to assist.<br><br>    Wet feet and coats must be wiped before entry into the suite.<br><br>    Pets must be clean and treated for fleas and ticks.<br><br>    We ask you to bring your pet's favorite bedding.<br><br>    If your dog takes an unexpected swim in the pond, don't worry, we would be happy to show you where the hose is if you need it. (Your puppy would not be the first!)<br><br>    Due to the large number of allergies, we are unable to accept cats or other pets.<br><br>    Hawthorn Estate, Main House Guest Rooms and Farmhouse are NOT pet friendly rooms.<br><br>   Pets are not permitted in dining rooms or common areas of houses.<br><br>    Please notify us if you have a service dog for these facilities and we will be happy to make accommodations for overnight stays, dining and common areas. Please supply inn with service dog certification papers and notify a staff member prior to arrival.

HIGHWAY1: None
COMMENTS: Surround Yourself with Water. Cross the bridge or take a ferry to the peaceful community of Dauphin Island. Located three miles south of the mouth of Mobile Bay, this barrier island provides the perfect getaway for you and your four-legged friend from the stresses of commercial and corporate life. The island's most redeeming quality is its emphasis on low-key, family oriented vacations. Forget road congestion, water parks and outlet malls - the island doesn't even have need for a traffic light. Instead, envision bike paths, walking trails, miles of dog-friendly, white sandy beaches and simplicity centered upon outdoor recreation.<br><br>Fort Gaines<br>Surround yourself with history at Fort Gaines. Completed in 1861visitors delight at this site of the Battle of Mobile Bay. Explore the grounds while hearing stories of yesteryear, watch live reenactments, see a blacksmith demonstrate his craft, and walk your pet through this historic military base. Please be sure to clean up after and leash your pet at all times.<br><br>Dauphin Island Campground<br>Surround yourself with friends at the Dauphin Island Campground. With our spacious wooded sites, complete with picnic tables, free boat launch, a boardwalk to the beach and hookups to accommodate tents or RVs. The grounds have a dog walk area to allow your pet to explore their new environment. There are a few marked areas your pet isn't allowed, but there are plenty more areas they can walk around. Please be sure to clean up after and leash your pet at all times.<br><br>Dauphin Island Beaches<br>Surround yourself with warm rays as soft, white, sugar sand squishes between your toes and the inviting waters of the Gulf of Mexico lap at your feet. These public beaches are some of the most pet-friendly around. Your dog can play in the water, run along the pier, or discover undeveloped areas of the beach. These areas can be found near the beach access at the pier and schoolhouse. Make sure to clean up after and leash your pet at all times.<br><br>Dauphin Island Parks<br>Surround yourself with nature. The island holds many parks that host various events throughout the year that you and your pet are welcome to enjoy with the island community. These parks run along Bienville Blvd and are open year-round. There are a few marked areas your pet isn't allowed, but there are plenty more areas they can walk around. Be sure to clean up after and leash your pet at all times.

TITLE: The "Historic" Marina Motel
ADDRESS: 2576 Lombard Street
CITY: San Francisco
MAJOR: 
STATE: CA
ZIP: 94123
PHONE: 415-921-3430
TOLLFREE: 800-346-6118
HIGHWAY: None
HIGHWAY1: None
BOOKCOMMENTS: Dogs of all sizes are allowed. There is a $15 per night pet fee for the first dog and $10 per night for the second dog.
COMMENTS: SAN FRANCISCO'S BEST KEPT SECRET **DOG HEAVEN** The "Historic" Marina Motel celebrates 75 years of European Charm with individually decorated rooms surrounding a flower filled cobblestone courtyard. Our Dog Friendly Rooms have fully equipped kitchens attached. FREE PARKING for one vehicle per room in individual garages under the rooms and a few outdoor spaces for larger vehicles (sorry no campers or U-Haul Trucks)<br><br> Put on Your Walking Shoes: Walk six blocks to a leash free beach where you can walk the sands to the Golden Gate Bridge. You can stop along the way at the Warming Hut for a latte or quick bit to eat as you watch the ships slip under the Golden Gate Bridge or the kite surfers catch some air. Along the way walk through the pet friendly gardens of Lucas Films (three blocks away) or follow the path that encircles the lake at the Palace of Fine Arts(four blocks away)to feed the swans. If you love to see the lives of the rich and famous, get ready to climb some of those hills that San Francisco is famous for and head straight from the Marina Motel up Broderick Street into Pacific Heights. Here you can stroll past the manicured front gardens of many castle-like mansions and enjoy their amazing views of the entire bay. When you get to the top, turn right and walk down the Lyon Street steps along side the Presidio and its extensive park lands and hiking trails. Keep an eye open for coyotes if you enter the Presidio in the early morning or around dusk.<br><br>Feel like a local as you sit in one of the many dog friendly sidewalk cafes and restaurants just around the corner on Chestnut, Fillmore and Union Streets. Besides having a few name brand stores like Pottery Barn, William Sonoma and the the Gap, Chestnut Street also has an array of boutiques, several jewelry stores, ice cream and candy stores, a high end pet store, two movie theaters, Marina Super with fresh produce displayed outside and a few nail salons for those in need of a manicure. Chestnut Street is also where our guests catch the #30 Bus which for $2 will drop you off at Fisheman's Wharf (7 min), Chinatown (15 min), Union Square (20 min) and AT&T ball park (30 min). This bus runs every 10-15 min and runs all night.<br><br>Pet policy: $15/night for the first dog, $10/night for second dog. NO SIZE RESTRICTIONS. Two dog max per room.  Besides the courtyard, we have a very cute dog run that is lit up at night for last minute pit stops before bed. We also have numerous doggie bag dispensers around the property and we kindly ask you to pick up after your dog on our property and elsewhere in the city, on the beach and on the trails. Sorry but due to barking issues, we no longer allow dogs to be left alone in our rooms unless they are crated.  Some guests leave their dogs in their cars with their windows partially down parked under the rooms for short periods of time during cool weather and we would be more than happy to check on your dog if this is the case.  Just let us know.

TITLE: The Cottages and Lofts at the Boat Basin
ADDRESS: 24 Old South Wharf
CITY: Nantucket
MAJOR: 
STATE: MA
ZIP: 02554
PHONE: 508-325-1499
TOLLFREE: 866-838-9253
HIGHWAY: None
HIGHWAY1: None
BOOKCOMMENTS: Dogs and cats are welcome in "The Woof Cottages." These cottages are one and two bedroom cottages which include special pet amenities like a welcome basket of pet treats and play toys, a pet bed, food and water bowls, and a Nantucket bandana. When you make a reservation, let them know what size your pet is, so they can have the appropriate size pet bed and bowls in the room. All cottages are non-smoking. There is a $75 one time per stay pet fee.
COMMENTS: Set against the blue waters of Nantucket Harbor, The Cottages & Lofts at the Boat Basin offer a front row view of the island's natural wonder. Enjoy waterfront cottages and lofts with decks and harbor views, kitchens, free Wi-Fi, bicycles, a beach bus and spa treatments. This idyllic hideaway is one block from the cobblestone streets of Nantucket Town lined with shops and restaurants, and minutes from beautiful beaches, sunset cruises, lighthouses, and adventure tours. Pet-friendly accommodations offer welcome bag of treats and toys, Blissful pet bed, food and water bowls, personalized pet tags and doggies turndown.  Dog walking service is available for a fee.<br><br>The Cottages kindly ask that pets be quiet at all times so as not to disturb other guests. Guests will be charged a non-refundable fee of $85 per pet, per stay. 10% of the fee will be donated to the local animal shelter, Nantucket Safe Harbor for Animals.<br><br>Guests of The Cottages & Lofts receive dining and spa discounts at their other premier hotels on island, White Elephant and The Wauwinet.  Ask at the front desk for details.  
OLDCOMMENTS: Forbes names WOOF Cottages one of the 11 Great Pet Friendly Hotels & Resorts in America.<br><br>Just steps from downtown Nantucket, the Woof Cottages are special 1- or 2-bedroom cottages with kitchens for guests with pets. Set within Nantucket Island's magnificent waterfront and just a short walk from historic downtown, the pet friendly Cottages & Lofts offer the ideal spot from which to explore the island.The view from The Cottages is a panorama of sun, sea and boats in Nantucket's busy harbor, all enjoyed from outdoor patios or decks where guests can host outdoor picnics or clambakes. Tour Nantucket Town and stroll down the cobblestone streets and narrow lanes of this faithfully preserved whaling seaport, home to ascinating shops, museums and fine restaurants.<br><br>The Cottages consist of 24 cottages with one, two and three bedrooms, and 5 lofts (studio cottages are also available). All have kitchens. Ideal for couples and families, The Cottages & Lofts at the Boat Basin are located directly on the docks at Swain's Wharf, Old South Wharf and Straight Wharf offering waterfront locations or water views. Designated "Woof Cottages" are pet friendly and provide special pet amenities.<br><br>Provisioning service: Your shopping list will be coordinated by our Pre-arrival Concierge and Front Desk. Items requested will be placed in your Cottage by 3 pm on day of your arrival. No alcohol or tobacco can be purchased. An 18% service charge applies and will be added to the retail cost of your items. Two night minimum stay required for this service which is available June through Labor Day.Parking Availability: There is no designated parking for The Cottages or The Lofts. Please ask about the Nantucket Regional Transit Authority (NRTA) bus service for convenient transportation around the island and to the beaches. The transit terminal is just a short walk from The Cottages and The Lofts. In addition, taxis are readily available. <br><br>Pet Policy Dogs and cats are welcome at this pet friendly lodging with prior innkeeper approval. Pets must be quiet, especially at night and are restricted to the Woof Cottages. A non-refundable pet fee of $75 per stay is required. We are pleased to announce that 10% of the pet fee will be donated to Nantucket Animal Charities. Pet Amenities An array of pet friendly amenities! Welcome basket of pet treats and play toys, blissful beds, food/water bowls, litter/litter box, and more! Dog walking/sitting services available. Doggie Turndown: Ellie, the new Cottages' mascot has lots of treats to pamper your pet.  Ellie's favorites are the tennis ball, the raw hide bone and the water bottle which comes in handy for a trip to the beach or a long hike.  Be sure to have your pet's picture taken to enter the Facebook Contest.  Details at the Front Desk.

HIGHWAY1: None
BOOKCOMMENTS: This luxury resort allows dogs up to 50 pounds. There is a $150 one time pet fee for dogs staying up to 6 nights. Dogs more than 50 pounds may be allowed at the discretion of the resort.
COMMENTS: Set amidst flowering cactus, breathtaking sunsets and framed against the majestic McDowell Mountains, Hyatt Regency Scottsdale Resort & Spa at Gainey Ranch features a spectacular 2  acre water playground complete with a three-story waterslide and white sand beach, 27 holes of championship golf, world-class tennis, miles of bicycling and jogging trails, Native American Learning Center and Experiential Vacations, destination specific activities on and off-property for leisure guests. Guests enjoy nightly entertainment in the casual sophistication of the Center Stage Bar after dining in one of the resort's distinctively different restaurants.<br><br>Energized by the delicious aromas and activity coming from its open kitchen, SWB, a casual Southwestern bistro offers wood-fired specialties featuring fresh seasonal ingredients.  Relax and enjoy breakfast, lunch, dinner and Sunday brunch indoors or out, set against a backdrop of the majestic McDowell Mountains.<br><br>Cross over the bridge and through a courtyard to find the vibrant, convivial setting of Alto ristorante e bar.  This comfortable Italian restaurant offers fresh and flavorful dishes with an emphasis on 'the season'.  Alto features its unique Formaggio & Salumi Cellar, a collection of Italy's best artisanal cheeses and meats.  An award-winning selection of wines from around the world, with an emphasis on Italy, is cradled on two wine walls.  Dinner is served both indoors and alfresco nestled around terrace fire pits, creating a very inviting atmosphere. The evening is complete with singing servers and a gondola ride along the resort's waterways.<br><br>Noh serves traditional sushi and sashimi complemented by authentic sakes.<br><br>On the go or on the trail, Canyon Market, a hiking lifestyle store, features Starbuck's Coffee, ice cream, sandwiches, salads and daily organic offerings along with performance food and gear essential for an active lifestyle.  Open 24 hours.<br><br>Carved out of the serene beauty of Arizona's Sonoran Desert comes Spa Avania, the first complete spa experience choreographed to the science of time.  Reflecting balance and harmony, it provides a total immersion experience based on the six spa elements deemed most essential to the body's changing rhythms and requirements.  These include customized treatments, mineral water therapy, music styling, natural light, diet, and the antioxidant benefits of the finest teas.  Guests enjoy this secluded setting overlooking the beauty of the spa's signature French Celtic Mineral Pool, lotus pond and the grandeur of Camelback Mountain.<br><br>For our four-legged guests, the "4Paws" pet rate, which must weigh 50 lbs or less* is $150.00 per stay up to 6 nights and $150.00 additional 'Deep Cleaning' fee from day 7 to day 30, non-refundable.  Reservations must be made in advance by calling 800 233 1234.  "Companions" must be on a leash or in a carrier when in public spaces throughout the resort. With the exception of service animals, "companions" are not allowed in the food and beverage areas per code statutes.<br><br>*Any pets over 50 lbs may be allowed at the Resort's discretion.

To avoid charges, please notify a staff member that more towels are needed, and we will be happy to assist.<br>- Wet feet and coats must be wiped before entry into the suite.<br>- Pets must be clean and treated for fleas and ticks.<br>- We ask you to bring your pet's favorite bedding.<br>- If your dog takes an unexpected swim in the pond, don't worry, we would be happy to show you where the hose is if you need it!. (Your puppy would not be the first!)<br>- Due to the large number of allergies, we are unable to accept cats or other pets. Hawthorn Estate, Main House Guest Rooms and Farmhouse are NOT pet friendly rooms.<br>- Pets are not permitted in dining rooms or common areas of houses.<br>- Please notify us if you have a service dog for these facilities and we will be happy to make accommodations for overnight stays, dining and common areas. Please supply inn with "service dog certification papers" and notify a staff member prior to arrival.

TITLE: Asheville Outlets

CITY: Asheville
MAJOR: 
STATE: NC
ZIP: 28806
PHONE: 828-667-2308
TOLLFREE: 
HIGHWAY: None
HIGHWAY1: None
BOOKCOMMENTS: This outlet shopping center is very pet-friendly with a dog park.
COMMENTS: Asheville Outlets. Real Brands. Unreal Savings. Save up to 70 percent off on America's most desired brands at Asheville Outlets, an open-air, pet friendly shopping destination developed by New England Development. Located at the intersection of I-40 & I-26 at Brevard Road, this new shopping destination features covered breezeways that provide natural airflow, a beautiful fire and water fountain, soft seating areas and year-round events and entertainment. Shoppers enjoy savings at close to 75 stores and eateries featuring some of the most popular brand names including Coach, J.Crew Factory, Tommy Hilfiger, Nike Factory Store, Under Armour, Abercrombie & Fitch Outlet, Brooks Brothers Factory Store, Vera Bradley, Cole Haan, West Elm Outlet, Dillard's Clearance Center, Field & Stream and more.<br><br>There is something for everyone at Asheville Outlets from women's and men's favorites at Tommy Hilfiger, Johnston & Murphy Factory Store and Under Armour, to children's brands at Carter's Babies & Kids, The Children's Place, Gap Factory Store and Justice. In a grassy area located near the West Elm entrance, pet owners can take their dogs for a cool drink of water and to enjoy the facilities. Bags and a receptacle are provided, along with their very own "fire hydrant."  To keep up-to-date on all the happenings at Asheville Outlets, follow on Facebook and Instagram @ashevilleoutlets and Twitter @shopasheville. Or visit us online at ShopAshevilleOutlets.com.
OLDCOMMENTS: Asheville Outlets. Real Brands. Unreal Savings. TITLE: Sandswept
ADDRESS: Northend at 83rd Street; Call to arrange
CITY: Virginia Beach
MAJOR: 
STATE: VA
ZIP: 23451
PHONE: 757-513-7555
TOLLFREE: 
HIGHWAY: None
HIGHWAY1: None
BOOKCOMMENTS: Dogs, subject to owner's approval, are allowed at this luxurious oceanfront home. There is an $85 one time additional pet fee.
COMMENTS: This luxurious oceanfront home has stunning views of the best beach in the exclusive north end of Virginia Beach. Nestled in a grove of live oaks and pine trees, this property feels like a private retreat from the moment you round the corner of the driveway. In a quiet residential neighborhood, this is the place to get away from it all!<br><br>3,200 SF on five levels plus two patios, a rooftop deck, two garden areas, a grove of live oaks, and playground for children give ample space for individuals in a large group to have moments of quiet retreat, making this home ideal for family gatherings.<br><br>Canine family members are welcome, subject to Owner's approval. An extra pet fee of $ 85 covers flea spray and extra cleaning. Dogs should be groomed, including nail trim, shortly before arrival and should be confined when left alone. Two large octagonal puppy pens are available if needed. A shaded, fenced dog yard can be shared with Owner's dogs who love playing with new dog buddies. Dogs are allowed off leash on the beach as long as they are "under direct, positive voice control at all times." In the summer dogs on the beach are restricted to the hours before 10:00 a.m. and after 6:00 p.m.<br><br>This home comfortably sleeps twelve people in four bedrooms. A fifth bedroom which has a separate entrance, a sixth bedroom next door in the Owner's home, and a queen air mattress for the music room are available for additional fees. The dining room seats 16.<br><br> A fully furnished rooftop deck has what is often described as "the best view in Virginia Beach". From there you can watch the dolphin, enjoy the weekly city fireworks, or savor sunrises, sunsets and full moons. Cook on the deck with the grill or cook in the kitchen and send food up in the dumb waiter! <br><br>Inspired by the Norfolk residency of Frank Lloyd Wright in 1953, and designed by local architect, Herbert Smith, this home was built in 1955 and is registered on the Virginia Beach Historic Register.<br><br>A spacious hot and cold exterior shower with two stalls helps your easily clean off the sand after the beach. A shower head on a 6 foot flexible hose makes it easy to clean Fido too. A beach cart makes it easy to carry small children and their toys, umbrellas, chairs, and snacks to the beach. Bring or rent a surfboard or kayak. We provide wheels to help roll the kayak down to the beach. Surfing is allowed before 10:00 a.m. and after 4:00 p.m. in the summer.<br><br>The grounds offer numerous places to retreat outside: a playground for the kids in the shade of the holly tree, two patios, one on the east side and one on the west, a pond with goldfish, and a garden that is a recognized wildlife habitat, full of flowers and bushes that attract and feed butterflies and hummingbirds.<br><br>No Smoking. Leave outside shoes at the door.

COMMENTS: Postcard Inn Beach Resort and Marina at Holiday Isle (or PCI for short) is an oceanfront Islamorada resort in the Florida Keys, minutes away from Key Largo and a short drive from Fort Lauderdale/Miami and Key West. This newly refreshed Florida Keys resort getaway is an iconic property that offers the retro, throwback feel of a nostalgic American beach vacation, combined with modern amenities, designer furnishings and a touch of whimsy. Guests are within short proximity of the Theatre of the Sea and the History of Diving Museum.  Many beach activities are included in your stay at Postcard Inn including kayaks, bicycle rentals, paddleboards, water bikes, volleyball and more! Book a fishing trip with one of our charter captains, enjoy a sunset cruise, join a dive/snorkel trip or rent jet skis to play the day away.<br><br>Guests do not have to leave Postcard Inn to dine. Jaws Raw Bar is a more casual outdoor dining outlet right on the water and is available for lunch and dinner.<br><br>Dogs up to 50 lbs are allowed and there is a $50 non-refundable cleaning fee per pet. Cats are also permitted but must be kept in a crate. Pets must be well-trained and aren't allowed on any furniture (in the room or on the beach). Owners must sign a pet waiver upon check in.

COMMENTS: One of the best kept secrets and favorite escapes of Keys aficionados, La Siesta Resort and Marina is located on 6-acres of oceanfront accessible by the historic Overseas Highway at mile marker 80.  La Siesta is less than 90 minutes from Miami, putting the resort in the heart of the lively Florida Keys, providing a tranquil escape among native flora and fauna for an uncommonly relaxing retreat. Escape from the everyday and embrace the natural beauty of Florida at its best. The shimmering blue hues of the Atlantic Ocean greet you upon arrival as the private sugar sand beach calls your name. <br><br>Whether you're running away for a romantic rendezvous, family-time, guys getaway or a weekend retreat with old friends, you'll be delighted and charmed with our La Siesta Resort. For those seeking relaxation at a slower pace paired with a personable staff ready to please, this sunny hideaway is the answer. La Siesta Resort amenities include a serene private beach, fresh water pool and inviting hot tub just steps away from our suites.<br><br>Need a little more adventure? Grab a bike from the front desk and experience local shopping, dining, and all of the other treasures Islamorada has to offer. If you think the first step to freedom is launching your boat, then La Siesta Resort and Marina can set you free. Keep in mind we are located in the Sport Fishing Capital of the World with effortless access to deep-water hot spots, bountiful back-country locales and a team of veteran guides unrivaled in the region.<br><br>La Siesta Resort & Marina allows up to two pets per room, weighing no more than 55 lbs each, for a non-refundable fee of $50 plus tax per stay. TITLE: Dog & Pony Ranch Guest House
ADDRESS: E Clinton Rd
CITY: Jackson
MAJOR: 
STATE: CA
ZIP: 95642
PHONE: 408-471-8757
TOLLFREE: 
HIGHWAY: None
HIGHWAY1: None
BOOKCOMMENTS: Dogs of all sizes are allowed. There is no additional pet fee.
COMMENTS: Escape to the beautiful Northern California Sierra foothills to enjoy nature from the comforts of a luxurious hilltop guest house with spectacular sunset views. It's the best of both worlds with the peaceful privacy of 60 rural acres plus the conveniences of being only a few miles from the Gold Country towns of Pine Grove, Jackson and Sutter Creek. The ranch is just 2-3 hours from the Bay Area so it's an easy getaway for many Californians.<BR><BR>What makes the Dog & Pony Ranch so special are the features that have been designed for 4-footed family members who are not just 'pets considered' but PETS WELCOME! The house has tile and stained concrete floors and leather furniture that are dog-fur resistant as well as beautiful.  Outside the doggie door there are fetching/agility lawns, a large swimming pond and miles of trails for dogs to run off-leash on the private fenced 60-acre property. Yes, people can enjoy the hiking and swimming too, but we think it's so much better with man's best friend by your side. <BR><BR>The dog-friendly features extend to our farm-stay experience as well. Our barn animals currently include horses, llamas, cattle and chickens who are safely separated with fencing so typically come running to meet guests and their dogs, since it often means extra treats for them! See our website for some of the many photos of dogs going nose-to-nose with our friendly horses and curious llamas. It's hard to say which of our guests enjoy the chickens more -- people eating their farm-fresh eggs or dogs watching the hens run around just a few feet away.<BR><BR>Ranch life doesn't have to be rustic for human guests as you'll see in our 5-star guest house with spectacular sunset views, hot tub, and luxury amenities. We host only one group at a time with up to 6 people, so you have as much privacy as you want in this relaxing rural paradise. Plenty of entertainment options are available including a big screen TV with satellite and Netflix, WiFi internet, a large game room with foosball, ping pong, darts, plus horseshoes, cornhole and a basketball court outside. Covered patios provide a perfect place to hot tub and watch the sun set over neighboring vineyards.<BR><BR>Dog-loving guests rave about our unique property and have nicknamed it 'Doggie Disneyland'. All well-behaved dogs are welcome (any size/number/breed) at $0 additional charge (unless damages).

ADDRESS: 1080 US Rte 3
CITY: Holderness
MAJOR: Lake Winnipesaukee Region
STATE: NH
ZIP: 03245
PHONE: 603-968-7269
TOLLFREE: 
HIGHWAY: None
HIGHWAY1: None
BOOKCOMMENTS: People traveling with dogs need to call to reserve a pet-friendly room.
COMMENTS: The Inn On Golden Pond, a top rated New Hampshire bed and breakfast, is located at the northern edge of the Lakes Region and in the foothills of the White Mountains. Originally built as a private colonial home it now serves the public as a nine-room country inn. Our Squam Lake bed and breakfast has been expanded and refurbished to provide the lodging experience and modern amenities that todays traveler expects and deserves. The Squam Lake area, including the neighboring towns of Plymouth, Meredith, Ashland, Sandwich, New Hampton and Center Harbor, offers a quintessential New Hampshire small-town experience.<br><br>At our New Hampshire bed and breakfast the rustic appeal of country living and the convenience of the 21st century meet. The Inn is surrounded by acres of woodland yet is only 3 miles from I-93. Our guests may see deer, bear or moose while eating breakfast and within minutes share that experience with friends anywhere in the world using our wireless internet service. Days of hiking in the wilderness or kayaking in secluded coves can be followed by evenings enjoying world class theater or gourmet dining. Or a day of endless business meetings and calls can be followed by a night where the only calls you'll hear are those of loons and the only thing endless is the number of stars sparkling in our country sky.<br><br>Whether you're trying to leave it all behind or trying to pack it all in, the Inn On Golden Pond is the spot for you. The perfect Lakes Region New Hampshire bed and breakfast - just as you imagined it.<br><br>The Inn on Golden Pond Features:  <br>Breakfast served daily and cooked to orderHomemade jams, breads and baked goods daily Tea, Iced Coffee available all day<br>Nightly turn down service<br>Air Conditioners in each room<br>Flat Screen TV's in all rooms<br>Private Baths in each room<br>Separate sitting area with comfortable chairs and foot rests in each room<br>Each room has individual thermostat for temperature control<br>Scenic drives close by<br>Free and ample parking<br>New Private Patio Area<br>Cookouts by request<br>Dinners by request<br>70' screened in front porch<br>Weddings, Family Reunions and Corporate retreat packages<br>Local Boat, Kayak & Paddleboard rentals<br>Mountain Biking and Hiking Trails nearby<br>Snowshoeing on property<br>Shuttle Service<br>Lawn games and Hammock for summer fun<br><br>The Inn On Golden Pond welcomes one medium size dog or cat for an additional fee of $45, per stay. Dog must be crated when left unattended in room. Aggressive and certain breeds of dogs are not permitted based upon our discretion . Guests traveling with pets must call 603-968-7269 prior to booking to verify availability of a pet-friendly room or risk not being able to check in with a pet and/or incurring any associated cancellation penalties. The hotel requires up-to-date vaccination records prior to check-in. Dogs and cats are not allowed in the Inn common areas including the patio and porch or other guest rooms.
